info.title: DataLakeAnalyticsCatalogManagementClient
info.description: Creates an Azure Data Lake Analytics catalog client.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The Azure Data Lake Analytics account upon which to execute catalog operations.

put.description: Creates the specified secret for use with external data sources in the specified database. This is deprecated and will be removed in the next release. Please use CreateCredential instead.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database in which to create the secret.

parameters.name: secretName
parameters.description: The name of the secret.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters required to create the secret (name and password)

200.description: Successfully created the specified secret in the specified database.

patch.description: Modifies the specified secret for use with external data sources in the specified database. This is deprecated and will be removed in the next release. Please use UpdateCredential instead.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database containing the secret.

parameters.name: secretName
parameters.description: The name of the secret.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters required to modify the secret (name and password)

200.description: Successfully updated the details of the specified secret in the specified database.

delete.description: Deletes the specified secret in the specified database. This is deprecated and will be removed in the next release. Please use DeleteCredential instead.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database containing the secret.

parameters.name: secretName
parameters.description: The name of the secret to delete

200.description: Successfully deleted the specified secret from the specified database.

get.description: Gets the specified secret in the specified database. This is deprecated and will be removed in the next release. Please use GetCredential instead.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database containing the secret.

parameters.name: secretName
parameters.description: The name of the secret to get

200.description: Successfully retrieved details of the specified secret in the specified database.

delete.description: Deletes all secrets in the specified database. This is deprecated and will be removed in the next release. In the future, please only drop individual credentials using DeleteCredential

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database containing the secret.

200.description: Successfully deleted all secrets from the specified database.

put.description: Creates the specified credential for use with external data sources in the specified database.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database in which to create the credential. Note: This is NOT an external database name, but the name of an existing U-SQL database that should contain the new credential object.

parameters.name: credentialName
parameters.description: The name of the credential.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters required to create the credential (name and password)

200.description: Successfully created the credential within the specified database.

patch.description: Modifies the specified credential for use with external data sources in the specified database

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database containing the credential.

parameters.name: credentialName
parameters.description: The name of the credential.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters required to modify the credential (name and password)

200.description: Successfully updated the specified credential's password in the specified database

post.description: Deletes the specified credential in the specified database

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database containing the credential.

parameters.name: credentialName
parameters.description: The name of the credential to delete

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to delete a credential if the current user is not the account owner.

parameters.name: cascade
parameters.description: Indicates if the delete should be a cascading delete (which deletes all resources dependent on the credential as well as the credential) or not. If false will fail if there are any resources relying on the credential.

200.description: Successfully deleted the specified credential from the specified database.

get.description: Retrieves the specified credential from the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database containing the schema.

parameters.name: credentialName
parameters.description: The name of the credential.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the specified credential (name only) from the specified database.

get.description: Retrieves the list of credentials from the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database containing the schema.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter. Optional.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The number of items to return. Optional.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: The number of items to skip over before returning elements. Optional.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: OData Select statement. Limits the properties on each entry to just those requested, e.g. Categories?$select=CategoryName,Description. Optional.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: OrderBy clause. One or more comma-separated expressions with an optional "asc" (the default) or "desc" depending on the order you'd like the values sorted, e.g. Categories?$orderby=CategoryName desc. Optional.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: The Boolean value of true or false to request a count of the matching resources included with the resources in the response, e.g. Categories?$count=true. Optional.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of credentials in the specified database.

get.description: Retrieves the specified external data source from the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database containing the external data source.

parameters.name: externalDataSourceName
parameters.description: The name of the external data source.

200.description: Successfully retrieved details of the specified external data source in the specified database.

get.description: Retrieves the list of external data sources from the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database containing the external data sources.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter. Optional.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The number of items to return. Optional.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: The number of items to skip over before returning elements. Optional.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: OData Select statement. Limits the properties on each entry to just those requested, e.g. Categories?$select=CategoryName,Description. Optional.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: OrderBy clause. One or more comma-separated expressions with an optional "asc" (the default) or "desc" depending on the order you'd like the values sorted, e.g. Categories?$orderby=CategoryName desc. Optional.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: The Boolean value of true or false to request a count of the matching resources included with the resources in the response, e.g. Categories?$count=true. Optional.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of external data sources in the specified database.

get.description: Retrieves the specified procedure from the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database containing the procedure.

parameters.name: schemaName
parameters.description: The name of the schema containing the procedure.

parameters.name: procedureName
parameters.description: The name of the procedure.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the specified procedure from the underlying database and schema combination.

get.description: Retrieves the list of procedures from the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database containing the procedures.

parameters.name: schemaName
parameters.description: The name of the schema containing the procedures.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter. Optional.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The number of items to return. Optional.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: The number of items to skip over before returning elements. Optional.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: OData Select statement. Limits the properties on each entry to just those requested, e.g. Categories?$select=CategoryName,Description. Optional.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: OrderBy clause. One or more comma-separated expressions with an optional "asc" (the default) or "desc" depending on the order you'd like the values sorted, e.g. Categories?$orderby=CategoryName desc. Optional.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: The Boolean value of true or false to request a count of the matching resources included with the resources in the response, e.g. Categories?$count=true. Optional.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of procedures in the specified database and schema.

get.description: Retrieves the specified table from the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database containing the table.

parameters.name: schemaName
parameters.description: The name of the schema containing the table.

parameters.name: tableName
parameters.description: The name of the table.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the specified table from the underying database and schema combination

get.description: Retrieves the list of tables from the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database containing the tables.

parameters.name: schemaName
parameters.description: The name of the schema containing the tables.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter. Optional.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The number of items to return. Optional.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: The number of items to skip over before returning elements. Optional.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: OData Select statement. Limits the properties on each entry to just those requested, e.g. Categories?$select=CategoryName,Description. Optional.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: OrderBy clause. One or more comma-separated expressions with an optional "asc" (the default) or "desc" depending on the order you'd like the values sorted, e.g. Categories?$orderby=CategoryName desc. Optional.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: The Boolean value of true or false to request a count of the matching resources included with the resources in the response, e.g. Categories?$count=true. Optional.

parameters.name: basic
parameters.description: The basic switch indicates what level of information to return when listing tables. When basic is true, only database_name, schema_name, table_name and version are returned for each table, otherwise all table metadata is returned. By default, it is false. Optional.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of tables in the specified database and schema.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: The Boolean value of true or false to request a count of the matching resources included with the resources in the response, e.g. Categories?$count=true. Optional.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of all table statistics in the specified database and schema.

get.description: Retrieves the list of access control list (ACL) entries for the database from the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter. Optional.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The number of items to return. Optional.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: The number of items to skip over before returning elements. Optional.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: OData Select statement. Limits the properties on each entry to just those requested, e.g. Categories?$select=CategoryName,Description. Optional.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: OrderBy clause. One or more comma-separated expressions with an optional "asc" (the default) or "desc" depending on the order you'd like the values sorted, e.g. Categories?$orderby=CategoryName desc. Optional.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: The Boolean value of true or false to request a count of the matching resources included with the resources in the response, e.g. Categories?$count=true. Optional.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of access control list (ACL) entries for the specified database.

get.description: Retrieves the list of access control list (ACL) entries for the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter. Optional.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The number of items to return. Optional.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: The number of items to skip over before returning elements. Optional.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: OData Select statement. Limits the properties on each entry to just those requested, e.g. Categories?$select=CategoryName,Description. Optional.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: OrderBy clause. One or more comma-separated expressions with an optional "asc" (the default) or "desc" depending on the order you'd like the values sorted, e.g. Categories?$orderby=CategoryName desc. Optional.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: The Boolean value of true or false to request a count of the matching resources included with the resources in the response, e.g. Categories?$count=true. Optional.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of access control list (ACL) entries for the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

get.description: Retrieves the specified database from the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the details of the specified database.

get.description: Retrieves the list of databases from the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter. Optional.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The number of items to return. Optional.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: The number of items to skip over before returning elements. Optional.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: OData Select statement. Limits the properties on each entry to just those requested, e.g. Categories?$select=CategoryName,Description. Optional.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: OrderBy clause. One or more comma-separated expressions with an optional "asc" (the default) or "desc" depending on the order you'd like the values sorted, e.g. Categories?$orderby=CategoryName desc. Optional.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: The Boolean value of true or false to request a count of the matching resources included with the resources in the response, e.g. Categories?$count=true. Optional.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of databases.

post.description: Grants an access control list (ACL) entry to the database from the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to create or update an access control list (ACL) entry for a database.

parameters.name: op
parameters.description: The constant value for the operation.

200.description: Successfully granted the access control list (ACL) entry to the specified database.

post.description: Revokes an access control list (ACL) entry for the database from the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: databaseName
parameters.description: The name of the database.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to delete an access control list (ACL) entry for a database.

parameters.name: op
parameters.description: The constant value for the operation.

200.description: Successfully revoked the access control list (ACL) entry from the specified database.

post.description: Grants an access control list (ACL) entry to the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to create or update an access control list (ACL) entry for a Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: op
parameters.description: The constant value for the operation.

200.description: Successfully granted the access control list (ACL) entry to the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

post.description: Revokes an access control list (ACL) entry from the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to delete an access control list (ACL) entry from a Data Lake Analytics catalog.

parameters.name: op
parameters.description: The constant value for the operation.

200.description: Successfully revoked the access control list (ACL) entry from the Data Lake Analytics catalog.

aceType.description: the access control list (ACL) entry type. UserObj and GroupObj denote the owning user and group, respectively.

principalId.description: the Azure AD object ID of the user or group being specified in the access control list (ACL) entry.

permission.description: the permission type of the access control list (ACL) entry.

AclCreateOrUpdateParameters.description: The parameters used to create or update an access control list (ACL) entry.

aceType.description: the access control list (ACL) entry type. UserObj and GroupObj denote the owning user and group, respectively.

principalId.description: the Azure AD object ID of the user or group being specified in the access control list (ACL) entry.

AclDeleteParameters.description: The parameters used to delete an access control list (ACL) entry.

aceType.description: the access control list (ACL) entry type. UserObj and GroupObj denote the owning user and group, respectively.

principalId.description: the Azure AD object ID of the user or group being specified in the access control list (ACL) entry.

permission.description: the permission type of the access control list (ACL) entry.

Acl.description: A Data Lake Analytics catalog access control list (ACL) entry.

AclList.description: A Data Lake Analytics catalog access control list (ACL).

password.description: the password for the secret to pass in

uri.description: the URI identifier for the secret in the format <hostname>:<port>

DataLakeAnalyticsCatalogSecretCreateOrUp.description: Data Lake Analytics catalog secret creation and update parameters. This is deprecated and will be removed in the next release. Please use DataLakeAnalyticsCatalogCredentialCreateOrUpdateParameters instead.

password.description: the password for the credential and user with access to the data source.

uri.description: the URI identifier for the data source this credential can connect to in the format <hostname>:<port>

userId.description: the object identifier for the user associated with this credential with access to the data source.

DataLakeAnalyticsCatalogCredentialCreate.description: Data Lake Analytics catalog credential creation parameters.

password.description: the current password for the credential and user with access to the data source. This is required if the requester is not the account owner.

DataLakeAnalyticsCatalogCredentialDelete.description: Data Lake Analytics catalog credential deletion parameters.

password.description: the current password for the credential and user with access to the data source. This is required if the requester is not the account owner.

newPassword.description: the new password for the credential and user with access to the data source.

uri.description: the URI identifier for the data source this credential can connect to in the format <hostname>:<port>

userId.description: the object identifier for the user associated with this credential with access to the data source.

DataLakeAnalyticsCatalogCredentialUpdate.description: Data Lake Analytics catalog credential update parameters.

creationTime.description: the creation time of the credential object. This is the only information returned about a secret from a GET.

uri.description: the URI identifier for the secret in the format <hostname>:<port>

password.description: the password for the secret to pass in

USqlSecret.description: A Data Lake Analytics catalog U-SQL secret item.

externalDataSourceName.description: the name of the external data source.

provider.description: the name of the provider for the external data source.

providerString.description: the name of the provider string for the external data source.

pushdownTypes.description: the list of types to push down from the external data source.

USqlExternalDataSource.description: A Data Lake Analytics catalog U-SQL external datasource item.

value.description: the list of external data sources in the database

USqlExternalDataSourceList.description: A Data Lake Analytics catalog U-SQL external datasource item list.

value.description: the list of credentials in the database

USqlCredentialList.description: A Data Lake Analytics catalog U-SQL credential item list.

USqlCredential.description: A Data Lake Analytics catalog U-SQL credential item.

schemaName.description: the name of the schema associated with this procedure and database.

definition.description: the defined query of the procedure.

USqlProcedure.description: A Data Lake Analytics catalog U-SQL procedure item.

value.description: the list of procedure in the database and schema combination

USqlProcedureList.description: A Data Lake Analytics catalog U-SQL procedure item list.

name.description: the name of the column in the table.

type.description: the object type of the specified column (such as System.String).

USqlTableColumn.description: A Data Lake Analytics catalog U-SQL table column item.

name.description: the name of the index in the table.

descending.description: the switch indicating if the index is descending or not.

USqlDirectedColumn.description: A Data Lake Analytics catalog U-SQL directed column item.

keys.description: the list of directed columns in the distribution

count.description: the count of indices using this distribution.

dynamicCount.description: the dynamic count of indices using this distribution.

USqlDistributionInfo.description: A Data Lake Analytics catalog U-SQL distribution information object.

name.description: the name of the index in the table.

indexKeys.description: the list of directed columns in the index

columns.description: the list of columns in the index

distributionInfo.description: the distributions info of the index

partitionFunction.description: partition function ID for the index.

partitionKeyList.description: the list of partion keys in the index

streamNames.description: the list of full paths to the streams that contain this index in the DataLake account.

isColumnstore.description: the switch indicating if this index is a columnstore index.

indexId.description: the ID of this index within the table.

isUnique.description: the switch indicating if this index is a unique index.

USqlIndex.description: A Data Lake Analytics catalog U-SQL table index item.

firstPart.description: the name of the table associated with this database and schema.

thirdPart.description: the name of the table associated with this database and schema.

server.description: the name of the table associated with this database and schema.

version.description: the version of the external data source.

tableName.description: the name of the table associated with this database and schema.

dataSource.description: the data source associated with this external table.

ExternalTable.description: A Data Lake Analytics catalog external table item.

name.description: the name of the field associated with this type.

columnList.description: the list of columns in this table

adlaCatalogDnsSuffixInPath.name: adlaCatalogDnsSuffix
adlaCatalogDnsSuffixInPath.description: Gets the DNS suffix used as the base for all Azure Data Lake Analytics Catalog service requests.
